intro: Gomphichis longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed gomphichis, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, typically found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. Gomphichis longiscapa is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used traditionally in herbal remedies.
